textos_fuente.text: FAQs | Fore Score Golf Tavern in Jacksonville, FL top of page Join Us FOR BRUNCH SUNDAYS 11am‚Äì3pm HOME PLAY BOOK A BAY LEAGUES MEMBERSHIPS FOOD & DRINK PRIVATE EVENTS HAPPENINGS Log In FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS FAQ'S‚Äã Each bay can hold up to 8 guests and can be booked up to 14 days in advance. ¬†You may hold up to 3 reservations at a time. Bays are reserved by the hour. ¬†Bays are assigned at the time of booking. ¬†We cannot guarantee a specific bay placement. ¬†Should you have a specific request, please contact us directly. It takes an average golfer roughly an hour and a half to play 18 holes. ¬†Golf not your thing? ¬†Not to worry.... Our bays provide opportunities to play soccer, basketball, dodgeball, baseball, hockey, & more! ‚Äã We provide clubs & sporting equipment for our games or you are welcome to bring your own. ¬†You are welcome to store your clubs with us prior to your reservation time, but we are not liable for any personal items you bring. All members of your reservation must sign a liability wavier prior to playing. We are a cashless establishment. ¬†Please plan to pay by credit card. ‚Äã Any questions? ¬†Reach out to us at 904-374-8851 or jax@forescoregolf.com ! BOOK A BAY QUICK LINKS ‚Äã Men u Book a Bay E-Gift Cards Blog FORE SCORE A GOLF TAVERN Join the Fore Score Golf Club & Stay Updated with the Latest! The San Marco Neighborhood | Visit Jacksonville Skip to content Newsletter Trip Planner 0 Saved 76 ¬∞ F Navigation Things to Do Beaches & Waterways Outdoors Family Fun Arts & Culture Shopping Sports Nightlife Dog-Friendly Tours Travel Guides and Itineraries Black Travel LGBTQ+ Travel Latino Travel Events Annual Events Submit Your Event Neighborhoods Beaches & Waterways Arlington Brooklyn Cathedral District Downtown Jacksonville Durkeeville Eastside Mandarin Murray Hill North Jacksonville & Airport Ortega Rail Yard District Riverside Avondale San Marco Southside Springfield Westside Food & Drink Jax Ale Trail Jax Coffee & Donuts Trail Mayport Shrimp Trail Distilleries Where to Stay Plan Your Trip Getting Here & Getting Around App & Brochures Newsletter Sign-Up Meeting Planners Newsletter Update Visitor Centers Jacksonville Webcams An Accessible Travel Guide Deals Weather Frequently Asked Questions Cruisin' for a Good Time Traveling to Jacksonville for Medical Treatment? Jax Join Our Volunteer Database Meeting Planners Newsletter Sign-Up Newsletter Sign-Up Group Sports Media Who We Are Blog Stay in Touch with Everything Jacksonville View Our 2025 Visitor Guide San Marco‚Äôs Iconic Lions Lion murals and sculptures are found throughout San Marco, and this striking mural by Keith Doles stands tall in the heart of the neighborhood. Stop by San Marco's tree-lined square San Marco Square, with its European statuary and fountain, serves as the neighborhood's focal point. San Marco Neighborhood Home Neighborhoods San Marco San Marco Spend the day exploring San Marco on the Southbank of the St. Johns River near Downtown. San Marco is a historic neighborhood just a few minutes from Downtown. Visit San Marco's distinctive boutiques and art galleries and enjoy the full-fledged dining district which has plenty of outdoor cafe seating and diverse options. Don't miss the San Marco fountain of lions, which reflect the neighborhood's association with the Venice, Italy business district. Save your appetite and visit the San Marco dining district, it includes some of Jacksonville‚Äôs best restaurants . Don't stop at just dinner, the area is emerging with trendy craft cocktail bars and brewery hot spots. Beach Buggy App provides FREE rides and recommendations to the visitors of the San Marco community. Eat & Drink See & Do Tours & Itineraries Local Businesses Eat & Drink Whatever your craving might be, you will find the perfect restaurant for you in the San Marco neighborhood. The San Marco Dining District includes some of Jacksonville‚Äôs most popular restaurants. Enjoy a progressive dinner or visit each restaurant for an unforgettable dining experience in one of Jacksonville‚Äôs most beautiful neighborhoods. Electric Dough - Chef Tom Gray created a new concept inside the old San Marco Theater. This retro pizza spot serves up inventive pies with creative toppings and a nostalgic vibe that‚Äôs anything but ordinary. Gemma Fish + Oyster - Gemma offers pristine oysters, fresh seafood and sophisticated dishes in a stylish, modern space with a rooftop space. Good Dough - This doughnut shop delivers small-batch treats in bold, unexpected flavors that are as Instagrammable as they are delicious. Check them out on the Jax Coffee & Donuts Trail ! Maple Street Biscuit Company - If you want Southern-style biscuits, look no further than Maple Street Biscuit Company. They are serving up biscuit sandwiches and comfort food classics in a down-home atmosphere. While this restaurant is now a regional chain, its humble beginnings started right here in the San Marco neighborhood. Matthew‚Äôs Restaurant - Matthew‚Äôs delivers expertly crafted dishes, impeccable service and one of Jacksonville‚Äôs nicest fine dining experiences. Rue Saint Marc - This French-inspired bistro blends modern technique with classic flavors, all served in a sleek, stylish setting. TAVERNA - Handmade pasta, wood-fired pizzas and Mediterranean dishes full of bold, seasonal ingredients are all on display at TAVERNA. Try out their seafood-forward concept right next door called Taverna Oceana . The Bearded Pig - Savor mouthwatering barbecue in a laid-back setting with a spacious backyard area that feels just like a friend‚Äôs cookout. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for families and kids to relax and enjoy. Town Hall - Town Hall features globally inspired fare, creative cocktails and a sleek dining space perfect for any occasion. Check them out for happy hour! V Pizza - V Pizza brings the heat with wood-fired Neapolitan pizzas made from fresh, Italian ingredients and baked to perfection. The 28 Best Drinks in Jacksonville After a long day there is nothing more satisfying than sitting down at a local #OnlyinJax bar and sipping on a hand-crafted beverage. Read More See & Do Located just minutes away from Downtown's Southbank is the historic neighborhood of San Marco. Stroll along San Marco Square and you'll discover incredible dining, upscale trendy clothing boutiques, and sensational art galleries. Theatre Jacksonville, the oldest community theatre in the country dating back to 1938, is also located within the square. Learn more about the history of the San Marco Neighborhood from the San Marco Preservation Society . Jack Rabbits Live - This intimate live concert venue is a beloved staple of Jacksonville‚Äôs music scene, hosting an eclectic mix of regional favorites and nationally touring artists. Jax Ale Trail - Cross off a few breweries on the Jax Ale Trail in San Marco. Visit Tepeyolot Cerveceria for Mexican food and craft beer and Aardwolf Brewing Company , one of the original breweries of Jacksonville. Riverfront Park - This spot is a wonderful location for city views, especially during the sunset. Wick: A Candle Bar - Wick offers a one-of-a-kind, hands-on candle pouring experience that‚Äôs perfect for a girls night out, date night or any special occasion. Design your custom scent! San Marco Tours & Itineraries San Marco Historic Neighborhood Tour The quaint San Marco neighborhood is home to many historic spots. Read More 36 Picture-Perfect Spots to Snap a Photo in¬†Jax Who doesn‚Äôt want to head home from vacation or a business trip with fond memories and amazing Instagram worthy photos‚Ä¶ Read More Jacksonville in the Movies ‚ÄúOn location in Jacksonville,‚Äù has been part of movie production history for over one hundred years. From the silent movie‚Ä¶ Read More Neighborhood Art¬†Maps There's no shortage of public art in Jacksonville. Download one of the maps below and start your tour¬†today. GolfBoard GOLFBOARD RESORTBOARD Models GolfBoard PRO GolfBoard V1.3 Refurb Pro Refurb V1.2 ResortBoard CaddieBoard Fleet Sales Where To Ride REPS Video Benefits Parts and Accessories CONTACT GOLFBOARD RESORTBOARD Models GolfBoard PRO GolfBoard V1.3 Refurb Pro Refurb V1.2 ResortBoard CaddieBoard Fleet Sales Where To Ride REPS Video Benefits Parts and Accessories CONTACT WELCOME Unique Design Advanced Technology ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY INCREASE REVENUE WELCOME Surf The Earth SHOP NOW SCROLL DOWN WELCOME Surf The Earth SHOP NOW SURF THE EARTH ON THE GOLFBOARD There is no better way to enjoy your favorite course than on a GolfBoard. Safe, Easy to learn, and environmentally friendly, anyone can ride like a pro in just a few minutes. With over 300 courses worldwide offering GolfBoard, and more adding every month, now is the time to Surf the Earth. Just click on the link below to find the a GolfBoarding course near you. where to ride MAINTAINS THE TRADITIONS OF THE GAME GolfBoarding changes the golfing experience, without changing the spirit and traditions of the game.¬†With over 300 courses now offering GolfBoard rentals, and hundreds of thousands of GolfBoarding rounds played, the GolfBoard has a proven ability to attract new players and energize the sport. FAREWELL TO THE 5 HOUR ROUNDS The GolfBoard dramatically increases the pace-of-play. After conducting extensive time trials‚Äîthe average 18-hole round on the GolfBoard is 2:37! Making it possible to play 36 holes in roughly 5 hours. Click Here to read a study by Today's Golfer about their comprehensive speed test comparison. They timed the same 4 golfers walking, using golf carts, and GolfBoarding. With each GolfBoarder going directly to their own ball at up to 10 MPH, it should be no surprise GolfBoard significantly speeds up the game. " Our winner in the New Age category is Golfboard , a combination of electronic snowboard and golf cart that allows you to traverse the course by maneuvering the device while standing on it, with your clubs right in front of you. Golfboard is fun, and it provides a bit of a workout for those feeling guilty about not walking. " ‚Äî Golf Digest ‚Äú If every golf course offered GolfBoards, golf would be the most popular sport in the world. ‚Äù ‚Äî Stina Sternberg, Golf Digest Global Golf Director Unique Design developed ¬†specifically for golf course use Unique Design developed ¬†specifically for golf course use GolfBoard‚Äôs unique and proprietary features make it ¬†¬† best-in-class Automatic Braking Ease of use and safety is optimized by an on-board computer that monitors speed and controls braking.¬†¬†¬†The rider simply releases the thumb throttle, and the board immediately decelerates and comes to a complete stop. Then an automatic rear axle parking brake locks the board in position even on the steepest hill.¬†¬†This provides you a stable structure to step off, and won't allow the GolfBoard to roll away even if you come to a stop at a tricky sidehill shot. Commercial Rental and Personal Use Options GolfBoard riders have the ability to select either high speed or low speed modes of operation. For the Commercial Use Board, low speed is a gentle 5 mph, allowing first time users the ability to practice turning and operating the board with security and confidence. Once new users have perfected their GolfBoarding skills, they can advance to a maximum speed of 10 mph. For personal use, GolfBoard offers an optional high performance package with low speed of 7 mph, and a maximum high speed of 12.5 mph on flat terrain, plus up to 14 mph down hill. This 25% to 40% increase in maximum speed also provides faster acceleration for those riders looking for a more adventuresome experience. 4 Wheel Drive Posi-Traction System GolfBoards are driven by front and rear gear boxes providing power to all four wheels. This proprietary 4 wheel Posi-Traction system provides solid climbing ability even on the steepest hills while simultaneously reducing turf wear. Intuitive Controls GolfBoards are primarily controlled using an ergonomically designed one-touch thumb throttle which allows the user to smoothly accelerate and decelerate. The throttle mechanism also features an intelligent LED battery charge level indicator.¬† A Hi / low speed option mounted on the Stability Bar allows the user to set their maximum speed preference,¬†along with a forward / reverse function that provides optimal maneuverability. Industrial Strength Motors &¬†Enclosed Drivetrain GolfBoards use the highest quality industrial grade electric motors with fully enclosed drivetrain to ensure reliability and low maintenance. ¬†Built to handle high-power industrial applications, the GolfBoard's motors are expected to be maintenance free for several years before requiring a simple and low cost replacement. True Turf Tires The GolfBoard utilizes tires specifically made for golf course use. Produced by the world's leading manufacturer of turf equipment tires, GolfBoard's ‚Äògentle-on-the-turf‚Äô tires provide maximum traction while minimizing turf wear. With the GolfBoards comparatively low weight distributed over the same surface area as much heavier equipment, there is substantially less impact and pressure on the turf than a fully loaded golf cart. Advanced Technology PLAY fast and enjoy the Ride Advanced Technology PLAY fast and enjoy the Ride Smooth Ride and ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Ideal Handling GolfBoards are the only board available with our proprietary "Spring Deck‚Äù technology utilizing a flexible spring plates. This Spring Deck technology gives GolfBoards amazing suspension and flex, while still allowing for a secure and rigid mounting location for our durable non-skid rhino liner deck. The GolfBoard's highly effective and adjustable shock absorber system provides an extremely smooth ride.¬†The Golfboard's suspension system can be quickly and easily adjusted to the performance preference and weight of each rider. Designed to have the lowest possible center of gravity, GolfBoards are extremely stable and provide a truly surf like experience.¬†¬†The low center of gravity allows the rider to feel like they are in contact with the terrain, plus makes it easy to step on the board at each shot. Batteries NOW AVAILABLE! Meet the latest GolfBoard models with an all new high capacity battery pack. This higher-powered battery pack features LG lithium-ion cells and has 48.8% more power than our original model and 12.2% greater power than our 2nd generation boards. The V1.3 GolfBoards are also more durable and easier to maintain and operate. All V1.3 GolfBoards have a new powder-coated steel stability bar, plus convenient external circuit breakers for ease of servicing and storage during the off season. The V1.3 GolfBoards will consistently deliver 27 holes of usage on one charge on all but the most demanding courses, plus have improved climbing ability on steep hills or slippery terrain. Golf course operators will be able to rent their fleet of GolfBoards for an 18-hole round plus a potential second 9-hole round without any recharging, or redeploy their GolfBoards for a 2nd 18-hole round with just under 1-hour of recharging. In contrast to lead acid batteries in regular golf carts that require tedious maintenance and long recharge times, the GolfBoard‚Äôs lithium battery requires zero maintenance, last longer, and are far lighter. ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY Reduces Turf wear ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY Reduces Turf wear The GolfBoard is ¬†¬†¬† Turf Friendly Every golfer loves playing on turf that is healthy and beautifully manicured. Day in and day out Golf Course Superintendents everywhere do battle with the forces that try to undermine their ability to produce these desired pristine playing conditions. Ironically, it‚Äôs the action of the golfers themselves that frequently causes the most amount of turf damage. Foot traÔ¨Éc and golf cart wear are the greatest contributing causes of damage to fairways. Out of strict concern for minimizing injury to turf, the GolfBoard has been engineered to make the smallest possible degree of turf impact. With approximately the same PSI as a golf cart (6lbs per square inch), but only 25% of the footprint, the GolfBoard can reduce turf wear by as much as 75%. The psi of a person walking is far greater than the psi of a golf cart or a GolfBoard. But psi alone is not the main cause of turf damage, it's redundant golf cart traÔ¨Éc patterns. The GolfBoard is much smaller and more maneuverable than a golf cart, which eliminates damaging recurrent traffic patterns, which helps keep grass healthier and superintendents happier. To read more about the GolfBoard's reduced effect on turf, please click HERE . GolfBoard's smaller footprint allows two GolfBoards to ¬†deliver 30% less impact on turf than one golf cart. INCREASE REVENUE NEW¬†REVENUE STREAMS FOR COURSE OPERATORS INCREASE REVENUE NEW¬†REVENUE STREAMS FOR COURSE OPERATORS The GolfBoard has proven to make golf¬†more popular and courses¬†more¬†profitable: Attract New Players - Golf is a game that players quickly come to love, but is largely still undiscovered by a new generation of potential life long fans. GolfBoard appeals to the younger action sports crowd looking for adventure,¬†excitement, and fun. Increase Frequency Of Play - The avid player is GolfBoard's biggest fan. With a GolfBoard you can complete a round in half the time, so you can play twice as often. Differentiate Your Course - GolfBoarding is an entirely new sport that most every golfer is eager to try. A rental fleet of GolfBoards provides an unique new offering that will attract players from other courses and keep them coming back for more. Guest & Media Buzz - Nothing generates more media attention and positive word of mouth than a new GolfBoard program. Your members and guests will help spread the word about just how much fun they had. Increase Rounds Played - After years of declining popularity, GolfBoard has proven time and time again to put courses back on track for strong growth. Many early adopters of GolfBoard have seen over a 30% increase in rounds played. Generate More Revenue - While the overall goal of GolfBoard is help courses attract new players, plus provide their members and guests a unique new way to enjoy the game, one of the greatest benefits is to a course's bottom line. Golfers and golf course owners believe the future growth of the game will include GolfBoard. American Music Preservation For the San Francisco Symphony Executive Director Brent Assink General Manager John Kieser Director of Artistic Planning John Mangum Media Production Manager Joyce Cron Wessling SFS Media Manager Andy Eiseman About Keeping Score Biographies In the News Products Support for Keeping Score Credits & Acknowledgements "[The Keeping Score programs] are, hands down, the best classical-music programs of their kind to be aired nationally in the U.S. since Leonard Bernstein‚Äôs Young People‚Äôs Concerts. [Michael Tilson Thomas] is the finest American conductor of his generation, and the only one who learned the lessons of Leonard Bernstein, using them to turn the San Francisco Symphony into the most adventurous, audience-friendly orchestra in America." ‚Äî Terry Teachout, The Wall Street Journal "Playing music well is difficult, yet the world has an abundance of fine performers. Explaining a little about music is easier, yet few do it well. Those who can do both supremely form a tiny club, whose honorary chairman is the conductor Michael Tilson Thomas." ‚Äî Justin Davidson, Newsday "The MTT Files [is] an illuminating and often profound look at the way classical music informs many of the larger concerns of our day, such as who we are as Americans and who owns music." ‚Äî Mark Swed, Los Angeles Times [MTT] has turned the San Francisco Symphony into an admirable education enterprise. The orchestra offers workshops and resources for K-12 teachers. It has produced flashy TV shows on Tchaikovsky, Beethoven, Stravinsky and Copland, all out on DVD and including some fine performances, plenty of scenic travelogue shots and rapid-fire morsels of information. If all the fast cutting isn't fast enough, a website ‚Äî www.keepingscore.org ‚Äî provides many of the small segments for those who like to click for tidbits. ‚Äì Los Angeles Times Privacy Policy | Terms of Use | SFSymphony.org | SFSkids.org | Contact Us ¬© 2011 San Francisco Symphony.
